channel.title: 强引力 on Dawn-19
channel.description: Recent content in 强引力 on Dawn-19

item.title: 论文笔记-strong_coupling
item.description:
The strong coupling problem

Genesis asymptotics: $t \to -\infty $, Universe$ \to $ flat spacetime, energy density $\rho = 0$.

During Genesis: a NECV stage, energy density grow, $E_{class}\propto (-t)^{-1}$.

Later stage, radiated dominated or genesis complements the inflationary scenario.

The Lagrangian:

$$ \mathcal{L} = G_2(\phi,X)-G_3(\phi,X)\Box\phi + G_4(\phi)R, $$

where $X = -\frac{1}{2}g^{\mu\nu}\partial_\mu \phi\partial_\nu \phi$.

Metric:

$$ \mathrm{d}s^2 = -N^2\mathrm{d}t^2+\gamma_{ij}(\mathrm{d}x^i + N^j \mathrm{d}t),\quad \gamma_{ij} = a^2 \mathrm{e}^{2\zeta}(\mathrm{e}^h)_{ij}. $$

Two-order analysis

Genesis tensor quadratic actions:

$$ S_{hh} = \int \mathrm{d}t\mathrm{d}^3 x N \frac{a^3}{8}(\mathcal{G}_T\frac{\dot{h}_{ij}}{N^2}-\frac{\mathcal{F}_T}{a^2}h_{ij,k}h_{ij,k}). $$

NECV metric:

$$ \mathrm{d}s^2 = -N^2\mathrm{d}t^2+h_{ij}(\mathrm{d}x^i + N^j \mathrm{d}t),\quad h_{ij} = a^2 \mathrm{e}^{2\zeta}(\mathrm{e}^\gamma)_{ij}. $$

NECV tensor quadratic actions:

$$ S_\gamma^{(2)} = \frac{M_p^2}{8}\int\mathrm{d}^4 x a^3 Q_T (\dot{\gamma}_{ij}^2 - c_T^2 \frac{(\partial_k \gamma_{ij})^2}{a^2}) $$

We can obtain

$$ M_p^2 Q_T = \mathcal{G}_T/N, \quad M_p^2 c_T^2 Q_T = N \mathcal{F}_T. $$

In the early time (Genesis), there are asymptotics

$$ \begin{split} \mathcal{F}_T \propto (-t)^{-2\alpha},\quad &\mathcal{G}_T\propto (-t)^{-2\alpha} \\ \mathcal{F}_S \propto (-t)^{-2\alpha+\delta},\quad &\mathcal{G}_S\propto (-t)^{-2\alpha+\delta}\\ \Theta\propto t^{-2\alpha-\delta-1} \end{split} $$

as $t\to - \infty$, and $\Theta = \Theta (\phi,N,G_3,G_4,G_5, X,H) $ .

The effective gravitational constant

$$ \begin{split} G_{eff} &= \frac{(\dot{\Theta }+ H\Theta)\mathcal{F}_S + (\dot{\mathcal{G}}_T - \dot{\Theta} \mathcal{G}_T/\Theta)^2}{\Theta^2 \mathcal{F}_S}\\ &\Rightarrow G_{eff}\propto t^{2\alpha+\delta} \end{split} $$

In the natural units $c=1$, $[G] = 1/M^2 = E^{-2}$, We find that the energy scale associated with interaction of nonrelativistic sources is actually of order $G_{eff}^{-1/2}\propto t^{-\alpha-\delta/2} $. we need $E_{strong}\gg E_{class}$, and we can obtain a stronger bound

$$ \alpha+\delta/2<1 $$

If $\alpha+\delta/2=0$, the $G_{eff}$ degrade to constant, that is apparently satisfied the requirement.

Third-order analysis (Only tensor)

The Lagrangian involving three tensors was derived in Ref[ arXiv:1108.3513]:

$$ \mathcal{L}_{h h h}=a^{3}\left[\frac{\mu}{12 N^{3}} \dot{h}_{i j} \dot{h}_{j k} \dot{h}_{k i}+\frac{\mathcal{F}_{T}}{4 a^{2}}\left(h_{i k} h_{j l}-\frac{1}{2} h_{i j} h_{k l}\right) h_{i j, k l}\right], $$

In the genesis model $G_5=0 \Rightarrow\mu=\dot{\phi}XG_{5X} = 0$, so only one term

$$ \frac{\mathcal{F}_{T}}{4 a^{2}}\left(h_{i k} h_{j l}-\frac{1}{2} h_{i j} h_{k l}\right) h_{i j, k l} $$

is need to analysis.

We can introduce canonically normalized tensor perturbation

$$ q_{ij} = \sqrt{\mathcal{G}_T} h_{ij}\propto (-t)^{-\alpha} h_{ij} , $$

the term can be schematically written as

$$ \mathbb{L}_{h h h} \propto \mathcal{F}_{T} \cdot\left(2 \mathcal{G}_{T}\right)^{-3 / 2} \cdot q^{3} \cdot\left(\partial_{t}\right)^{0} \cdot(\partial)^{2} . $$

The dimension of coefficient $\mathcal{F}_T \cdot(2 \mathcal{G}_T)^{-3 / 2}$ is 1-2=-1 ,

So the energy associated with $\mathbb{L}_{h h h} $ is

$$ \begin{split} E_{strong}^{hhh}& \propto (\mathcal{F}_T \cdot (2\mathcal{G}_T)^{-3/2})^\frac{1}{-1}\propto(-t)^{-\alpha}\gg (-t)^{-1}\\ &\Rightarrow \alpha<1 \end{split} $$

参考：arXiv:2003.01202
